repnme.cdata!:
Slovenia - Technical Support and Investment
            Project for the Phaseout of Ozone Depleting Substances

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project performance was
            very good, with satisfactory technical solutions. The sharp
            improvement in positioning the business enterprises, was due
            to the successful project implementation. Both the
            Bank's and the Borrower's performances were
            satisfactory, with exemplary cooperation between the project
            management entities and the participating enterprises.
            Regardless of success, some key lessons are suggested as
            follows: 1) careful planning requires early consideration,
            the absence of which is perceived to be the reason for minor
            failures, such as lack of funds resulting from poor
            planning, or unnecessary procurement procedures. It is
            suggested, the Project Implementation Units (PIUs) should
            ensure that participating enterprises cover a feasible
            implementation plan, to be studied well ahead of time.
            Furthermore, the provision of detailed information on the
            Bank's procurement guidelines and procedures should be
            enhanced, thus local enterprises would acquire a broader
            knowledge of the benefits stemming from international
            competitive bidding.

728068.trustfund:
TF028305-GEF1-SLOVENIA TECH. SUPPORT FOR
            ODS PHASEOUT

repnme.cdata!:
Slovenia - Technical Support and Investment
            Project for the Phaseout of Ozone Depleting Substances

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the Phaseout
            of Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) Project is to assist
            Slovenia in the phaseout of ODS consumption in a cost
            effective manner as mandated by the Montreal Protocol and
            its amendments and adjustments. Specifically this project
            will assist Slovenia to: 1) support the phaseout of the
            consumption of chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) through adoption
            of new cost-effective CFC-free technologies; and 2) through
            institutional strengthening improve the capability of the
            Ministry of Environment and Physical Planning (MEPP) to
            manage and oversee the phaseout of ODS in Slovenia. The
            project consists of the following components: 1) an
            investment component comprising six sub-projects; and 2) an
            institutional strengthening component.
